result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Copy of minutes from BBH Hrg on 6/21/22 and bond form sent electronically to DCJ.

The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: __ GPS, _X_ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing.
- Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant must reach out to health care provider to assist with resources to address alcohol addiction.
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with James D except only for bona fide emergencies. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney David Karpe.  Tomas Fernando Valerio appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Argument by Defn. State objects, argument by State. CT orders ($500) signature bond and referral to DCPS w/ remote breath. CT adds "Defendant must reach out to health care provider to assist w/ resources to address alcohol addiction." ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN THE SAME.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

Preliminary hearing on June 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

Cash bond is set in the amount of $800 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: __ GPS, _x_ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with James D except only for bona fide emergencies. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
